description: Actinic Solar Damage, also known as Actinic Cheilitis, is a condition characterized by damage to the lips and surrounding skin caused by long-term exposure to the sun's ultraviolet (UV) rays. This can lead to dryness, cracking, and potentially precancerous changes in the affected area.
possible causes: Prolonged exposure to UV radiation from the sun
symptoms: Persistent dryness and cracking of the lips
White or gray discoloration of the lip skin
Swelling or thickening of the lip skin
Development of rough, scaly patches on the lips
treatments: Application of lip balms with SPF protection
Regular use of sunscreen on the lips
Topical medications or treatments prescribed by a dermatologist
